definition: group buying/collective buying/buying by a group of individuals who negotiate a discount for the group
round/lump/ball/to roll into a ball/to gather/regiment/group/society/classifier for a lump or a soft mass: wad (of paper), ball (of wool), cloud (of smoke)

sentences.english: Yes, I was last year formal abdication comes down to run Hefei group to buy a network.

sentences.english: The ability to group-buy with friends gives users discounts and deals.

sentences.english: BlackBerries, as an example, are most often purchased by corporate customers.

sentences.english: From the consumer's perspective, Groupons can be very deeply discounted.

sentences.english: With group buying you go in together and get far better deals.

sentences.english: He says few of his friends are frequent users of group-buying websites.
